snippet: At least 29,000 Syrians have flooded into northern Iraq since Thursday, which the United Nations says is one of the largest cross-border migrations since the Syrian conflict began in 2011.
abstract: United Nations refugee agency says at least 29,000 Syrians have flooded into northern Iraq over course of four days, calling it one of the largest cross-border migrations since the Syrian conflict began in 2011.
lead_paragraph: At least 29,000 Syrians have flooded into northern Iraq since Thursday, which the United Nations says is one of the largest cross-border migrations since the Syrian conflict began in 2011.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
